title: OIDC `TenantConfigResolver` and `TenantResolver` are called even if the tenant id is already resolved
body:
### Describe the bug

There are 2 cases right now where the OIDC tenant id is resolved before the tenant resolution code calling either `TenantConfigResolver` or `TenantResolver`, and other default resolvers starts runnning:
* When `@Tenant("sometenant")` annotation is used to resolve the tenant
* When the OIDC code flow session cookie is used to resolve it

In both cases, `TenantConfigResolver` or `TenantResolver` will still be called.

With `TenantResolver`,  the side-effect is minor, it just has to repeat the boilerplate:

```
String tenantId = getIdFromRoutingContext(rc);
if ((tenant != null) {
    return tenant;
}
``` 

but with `TenantConfigResolver` which returns an OidcTenantConfig instance, it is much worse, because unless it is a very limited number of configurations which can be just stored easily in the Map, users have to reread this config from some external source, or think of some more involved caching support. This is why I'm qualifying it as a bug.

But it should not be required since Quarkus already has the knowledge of the resolved OIDC tenants.

CC @calvernaz

### Expected behavior

_No response_
